Detailed Description

This header defines the GTI APIs for retrieving explanations of errors.

Copyright (c) 1998-2017, Texas Instruments Inc., All rights reserved.

Custom "Abort" button.

Custom "Continue" button.

Custom "Update" button.

#define GTI_CUSTOM_YES   0x00010000

Custom button flags returned from GTI_GETERRSTR_EX3().

Client should call GTI_SETERRRESPONSE() when one of these is selected. Custom "Yes" button.

#define GTI_ERR_ABORT   0x00000100

Abort button, client should quit the entire application.

#define GTI_ERR_AUTO_RETRY   0x00000080

Auto Retry button, client should continually retry operation.

#define GTI_ERR_BREAK   0x00000008

Set or clear of breakpoints.

#define GTI_ERR_CACHE   0x00000100

Manipulating target cache.

#define GTI_ERR_CANCEL   0x00000010

Cancel button, client should cancel current operation.

#define GTI_ERR_CATSCAN   0x00008000

Perform a CATSCAN.

#define GTI_ERR_CMD   0x00000001

Error class flags returned from GTI_GETERRSTR_EX3().

Error classes represent the context in which the error happened. These may be combined when appropriate (e.g. a software breakpoint could be class = GTI_ERR_BREAK | GTI_ERR_MEMORY). Check validity requested command.

#define GTI_ERR_CNTRL   0x00002000

Debug probe error.

#define GTI_ERR_COMM   0x00000080

Debug probe communication (unused).

#define GTI_ERR_CONTROLLER_FATAL   0x00800000

Error severity flags returned from GTI_GETERRSTR_EX3().

Error severity represents both the severity and the scope of the error. It indicates how severe the error is and if the error affects the current request (operation), target, or whole system.

Controller errors are debug probe problems that affect all targets.
Processor errors are errors that affect only the current target.
Task errors were intended for multi-threaded debug and not supported.
Request errors are errors affecting the current operation or request.
Debug probe isn't communicating at all.

#define GTI_ERR_CONTROLLER_SEVERE   0x00400000

Debug probe is OK but a problem affects all targets.

#define GTI_ERR_CONTROLLER_WARN   0x00200000

Warning related to debug probe.

#define GTI_ERR_EMURESET   0x00000200

Reset button, client should disconnect all and reset the debug probe.

Function Documentation

GTI_EXPORT GTI_INT_TYPE GTI_GETERRSTR_EX3 ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid,
GTI_INT_TYPE *  pSequenceId,
GTI_INT_TYPE *  pErrorCode,
GTI_UINT32_TYPE *  pErrorClass,
GTI_UINT32_TYPE *  pSeverity,
GTI_UINT32_TYPE *  pAction,
GTI_UINT32_TYPE *  pButtons,
GTI_UINT32_TYPE *  pIcon,
GTI_STRING_TYPE  pszCustomButtons,
GTI_UINT32_TYPE  customButtonsLength,
GTI_STRING_TYPE  pszErrorMessage,
GTI_UINT32_TYPE  errorMessageLength 
)

GTI_GETERRSTR_EX3() - Return pending error message from the driver.

This function returns whatever error message is pending in the driver. This also returns information about the severity of the error and describes what buttons should be displayed for the user. The client should display a dialog with the error text and buttons, and then handle the user's response.

Returns:
1 if an error was returned, 0 if no error was returned.
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
[out]pSequenceIdThe command index that caused the failure.
[out]pErrorCodeThe error number that represents the error.
[out]pErrorClassIdentifies where in the stack the error occurred.
[out]pSeveritySeverity of error and group (e.g. Fatal, Controller).
[out]pActionThe default action that client should take (unused).
[out]pButtonsWhich buttons should be displayed with the error text.
[out]pIconWhich icons should be displayed with the error text.
[out]pszCustomButtonsA string of at least 64 characters to return custom buttons.
[in]customButtonsLengthLength of custom buttons string.
[out]pszErrorMessageA string of at least 1024 characters to return error text.
[in]errorMessageLengthLength of error string.
Examples:
CortexA8_Linux_Example.cpp, CortexA8_PRSC_Example.cpp, and GTI_API_Example.cpp.
GTI_EXPORT GTI_RETURN_TYPE GTI_SETERRRESPONSE ( GTI_HANDLE_TYPE  hpid,
GTI_INT16_TYPE  button,
GTI_UINT32_TYPE  ErrorID 
)

GTI_SETERRRESPONSE() - Handles responses to custom error results.

This function provides device specific handling of custom error results. When the error message returned by GTI_GETERRSTR_EX3() includes custom buttons, the client should present a dialog to ask the user to select an action. This function is used to execute the code required to perform the chosen action when the user selects a custom button.

Returns:
0 on success, -1 on error
Parameters:
[in]hpidGTI API instance handle.
[in]buttonIndex of custom button pressed.
[in]ErrorIDError number from GTI_GETERRSTR_EX3()
